basecamps.name: Oonchiumpa
basecamps.description: Aboriginal community-controlled organisation working across 7 language groups within a 150km radius of Alice Springs, partnering with 32+ organisations.
programs: True Justice: Deep Listening on Country

storytellers.name: Kristy Bloomfield
storytellers.bio: Kristy Bloomfield is a visionary leader and passionate advocate for Indigenous empowerment and community. She leads Oonchiumpa with deep cultural authority and has built partnerships with over 32 organizations across Central Australia.
storytellers.quote: Connection to culture, country, and elders is the foundation of healing.

storytellers.name: Tanya Turner
storytellers.bio: Tanya Turner is a proud Aboriginal woman from Central Australia, whose journey reflects resilience and determination. She brings expertise in Indigenous justice, legal practice, and community development.
storytellers.quote: Our young people need to know they are valued - not by the system, but by their own mob.

storytellers.name: Aunty Bev and Uncle Terry
storytellers.bio: Aunty Bev and Uncle Terry are cherished custodians of Alice Springs' vibrant history, deeply rooted in community resilience and cultural heritage.
storytellers.quote: Strong young people come from strong families connected to country.

storytellers.name: Professor Helen Milroy
storytellers.bio: Professor Helen Milroy leads the True Justice Initiative partnership with Oonchiumpa, focusing on deep listening and restorative justice approaches since 2022.

videos.title: True Justice: Deep Listening on Country
videos.description: Documentary exploring Oonchiumpa's partnership with ANU's True Justice Initiative, showing how deep listening and cultural healing transforms young people's lives.

videos.title: Atnarpa Homestead - On Country Experience
videos.description: Young people share their experiences at Atnarpa Station, connecting with country, elders, and traditional knowledge.

basecamps.name: BG Fit
basecamps.description: Transforms youth empowerment through the CAMPFIRE framework (Culture, Ancestral Wisdom, Mentoring, Personal Growth, Fitness, Identity, Resilience, Empowerment) and BAIL (Be An Indigenous Leader) program.

storytellers.name: Brodie Germaine
storytellers.bio: Brodie Germaine, a proud Pita Pita Wayaka man from Mount Isa, founded BG Fit to transform youth empowerment through fitness. His CAMPFIRE Project and BAIL program blend fitness, cultural connection, and mentorship to create pathways for Indigenous youth.
storytellers.quote: Every young person deserves someone who believes in them. We show up, every day, no matter what.

storytellers.name: Aunty Corrine
storytellers.bio: Aunty Corrine has supported 25 young people through the justice system over 20 years - unpaid, 24/7, with unwavering dedication. She represents the community expertise that funded services often replicate but never match.
storytellers.quote: I got the voice. But I need voices behind me to make things work in this community.

videos.title: CAMPFIRE Project: Changing Lives in Mount Isa
videos.description: Documentary following the CAMPFIRE framework in action with young people in Mount Isa.

videos.title: BAIL Program: Be An Indigenous Leader
videos.description: Young people and mentors explain how the BAIL program combines fitness training with cultural connection to build leaders.

basecamps.name: Mounty Yarns
basecamps.description: Youth-led storytelling organization that grew from 1 person to a 20-person team, producing documentaries, podcasts, and community journalism that challenge deficit narratives about Western Sydney.

storytellers.name: Mounty Yarns Youth Collective
storytellers.bio: Mounty Yarns is led by young people from Mount Druitt who grew the organization from 1 person to a 20-person team. They produce documentaries, podcasts, and community journalism that challenge deficit narratives about Western Sydney.
storytellers.quote: We need more people who give a fuck and actually ask what we want.

storytellers.name: Young Storytellers Network
storytellers.bio: Over 50 young people have been trained in media production through Mounty Yarns, creating content that reaches over 100,000 people and challenging mainstream narratives about their community.
storytellers.quote: Imagine reconnecting with your blood brothers after being in care for so long, and it's in jail.

stories.title: Just the usual
stories.quote: For us, there are no good interactions with police.
stories.summary: A semi-final OzTag match turns into another police chase, showing how constant surveillance blocks young people from feeling safe in their own neighbourhood.

stories.title: I can't even walk down the street
stories.quote: Anytime we're anywhere we have our escape routes planned in case we need to run.
stories.summary: From childhood, police harassment engrains fear and trauma, pushing kids into fight-or-flight on everyday walks through Mount Druitt.

stories.title: Another overnighter
stories.quote: The police say things to me to get me to bite back at them. Real racist things.
stories.summary: Bail refusals, racist taunts and impossible conditions keep young people trapped in cycles of overnight custody.

stories.title: Koori Court is probably the best thing I know
stories.quote: In Youth Koori Court they actually see the effort you're making.
stories.summary: Youth Koori Court centres Elders, culture, and relationships, giving young people a real shot at change.

stories.title: Can't hold us down
stories.quote: Imagine reconnecting with your blood brothers after being in care for so long, and it's in jail.
stories.summary: Mounty Yarns grows from lived experienceâ€”building community-run solutions that keep families together.

videos.title: Mounty Yarns Documentary
videos.description: The full 24-minute documentary produced by young people from Mount Druitt, sharing their experiences with policing, education, custody, and community.

basecamps.name: PICC Townsville
basecamps.description: Palm Island Community Company supports Bwgcolman (Palm Island) and broader North Queensland Pasifika families through cultural connection, family strengthening, and diversion programs.

storytellers.name: PICC Leadership Team
storytellers.bio: PICC (Palm Island Community Company) is led by community members who understand that culture is protection. With 197 staff, they deliver services across North Queensland while maintaining connection to cultural identity.
storytellers.quote: Strong cultural identity protects young people from harm.

videos.title: PICC Station Precinct Vision
videos.description: The transformation of PICC Station Precinct into a regional hub for cultural programs, family services, and community gathering.

sharedServices.name: Storytelling & Content
sharedServices.description: Professional video production, photography, case study documentation, and impact story writing. Your stories, professionally captured.
sharedServices.coreBenefit: Quarterly video shoots + ongoing content support

sharedServices.name: Communications & Marketing
sharedServices.description: Social media management, newsletters, media relations, and crisis communications support.

sharedServices.name: Bookkeeping & Accounting
sharedServices.description: Day-to-day bookkeeping, monthly reconciliations, BAS preparation, and financial reporting.

sharedServices.name: Grant Acquittals & Reporting
sharedServices.description: Financial acquittal preparation, grant reporting, and compliance documentation for funders.
sharedServices.coreBenefit: Full acquittal management for all grants

sharedServices.name: Payroll & HR Admin
sharedServices.description: Payroll processing, superannuation, leave management, and HR administration.

sharedServices.name: Recruitment & Onboarding
sharedServices.description: Job ads, candidate screening, interview support, and onboarding documentation.

sharedServices.name: Grant Writing & Fundraising
sharedServices.description: Grant application writing, funding research, and submission management.

sharedServices.name: Philanthropy Matching
sharedServices.description: Direct introductions to verified philanthropists and corporate sponsors aligned with your work.

sharedServices.name: Governance & Compliance
sharedServices.description: Board training, ACNC compliance, policy templates, and governance capacity building.

sharedServices.name: Legal Triage
sharedServices.description: Contract review, legal advice triage, IP protection, and advocacy support.
sharedServices.coreBenefit: Dedicated legal partnerships with NATSILS, ALS NSW

sharedServices.name: Technical Infrastructure
sharedServices.description: Website hosting, email systems, CRM, data management, and cybersecurity.

sharedServices.name: Data & Evaluation
sharedServices.description: Program evaluation, data collection tools, impact measurement, and evidence documentation.

sharedServices.name: Admin & Coordination
sharedServices.description: Virtual admin support, event coordination, procurement, and logistics management.

sharedServices.name: Community Connectors
sharedServices.description: Dedicated relationship managers who understand your community and coordinate all services.

sharedServices.name: Incident & Issue Tracking
sharedServices.description: Secure, culturally-safe reporting system for documenting incidents and systemic issues.
sharedServices.coreBenefit: Full platform access with analytics dashboard

core.name: CORE
features: ALMA intelligence dashboard with real-time data

milestones: Transfer majority control to Indigenous Advisory Board
Legal structure for community trust established
75% of youth encounters resolved in community
CORE partnerships transition to mixed funding
Indigenous parity progress (within 10% of non-Indigenous rates)
50% of youth justice interventions are Community Controlled
Zero detention for youth under 14 nationally

revenueStreams.name: State Government Licenses
revenueStreams.description: Annual subscription to ALMA intelligence for policy development, outcome tracking, and national benchmarking.

revenueStreams.name: Corporate Sponsorships
revenueStreams.description: Companies sponsor intervention types aligned with CSR goals, with 60% flowing directly to community programs.

revenueStreams.name: Research Partnerships
revenueStreams.description: Universities license ALMA data with Indigenous governance oversight and community co-authorship.

revenueStreams.name: Story Licensing
revenueStreams.description: Media licensing of community stories with revenue shared directly with storytellers who own copyright.

fundingCases.name: Mindaroo Foundation
fundingCases.impact: Platform becomes self-sustaining, 29 communities supported, $360K/year to communities by Year 3
